title: 210+ Funny Questions to Spark Conversations with Anyone

steps.title: Spark a great conversation with a classic opening line.
steps.content: Spark a great conversation with a classic opening line. Using a humorous opener is a great way to start a lighthearted conversation that makes you both feel good chatting with each other. However, certified image consultant Lynda Jean recommends steering clear of potentially sensitive subjects like politics and religion. Try one of these classic funny openers to start things off on the right foot: â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest joke you know?â€ â€œWhat is the most unusual thing youâ€™re afraid of?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the absolute worst name that you could give your child?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most unusual thing youâ€™ve ever eaten?â€ â€œWhat was your most embarrassing fashion phase?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest text youâ€™ve ever gotten?â€ â€œWhat is it about your teenage self that embarrasses you the most? â€œWhat 2 jobs would you combine to make your dream job? Mineâ€™s space-cowboy.â€ â€œWhat would be the title of a book about your life?â€ â€œWhat food describes your personality? â€œWhatâ€™s a commonly held belief you think is complete trash?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the strangest thing thatâ€™s ever happened to you?â€ â€œWhat is your most unusual talent?â€ â€œWhat 2 things could you buy at a grocery store that would make the cashier the most uncomfortable?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your funniest excuse for leaving a party?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite meme of all time? Why?â€ â€œWhen was the last time you laughed so hard you cried?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the craziest dream youâ€™ve ever had?â€

steps.title: Give them a chuckle with a random, quirky question.
steps.content: Give them a chuckle with a random, quirky question. Sometimes, the best way to start a conversation with a laugh is to take the other person by surprise with a random question. Licensed clinical psychologist Donna Novak says, â€œIn general, I really would urge people to ask a question because people tend to really get engaged with questions.â€ And if you want to get a laugh, the quirkier, the better. Try, starting your next conversation off with one of these funny openers: â€œWhat would be your professional wrestling name?â€ â€œWhat TV or movie character reminds you of yourself? Why?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to karaoke song?â€ â€œDo you believe in ghosts? Why?â€ â€œWould rather have no eyebrows or no eyelashes?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s one thing everyone looks silly doing?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the dumbest thing youâ€™d buy if you won the lottery?â€ â€œWhat celebrity do you irrationally hate?â€ â€œIf the color blue had a smell, what would it be?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your most random pet peeve?â€ â€œIf you could have an extra body part, what would it be?â€ â€œWhat movie would be the worst if you made it into a musical?â€ â€œIf you were a candy bar, which one would you be?â€ â€œIf you worked in the circus, what would your job be?â€ â€œIf animals could talk, which would be the rudest?â€ â€œWhat random song do you know all the lyrics to?â€ â€œIf you could only eat 3 things for the rest of your life, what would they be?â€ â€œWhat would your quirky celebrity baby name be?â€

steps.title: Kick off a deep conversation with a funny opener.
steps.content: Kick off a deep conversation with a funny opener. Sometimes, the most in-depth, rewarding conversations start with a funny question. One of the great things about humor is that it can help you deal with heavy subjects or intense emotions by diffusing tension. [1] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source By starting your conversation with an amusing opener, you set a friendly tone for even the most serious subjects. So, go with one of these funny lines to start a deep conversation thatâ€™s free of any tension: â€œWhat inanimate object would you want to be reincarnated as?â€ â€œWhat 2 songs are probably playing on a loop in hell?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest epitaph you would put in your tombstone?â€ â€œIs there intelligent life in the universe?â€ â€œIf you were a character in a children's book, what heartwarming life lesson would you teach?â€ â€œWhich vegetable do you trust the least?â€ â€œHow do you feel about clowns?â€ â€œHow many french fries is it okay for a friend to take before you tell them to order their own?â€ â€œWhat crazy conspiracy theory do you kind of think is true?â€ â€œWhy does your brain keep playing that same song over and over?â€ â€œWho is your nemesis?â€ â€œThe zombie apocalypse is coming. Who are the three people you want on your team in order to survive?â€ â€œWhat is the ideal proportion of cupcake to icing?â€ â€œWould you rather have 5 half-sized clones of yourself or 1 full-sized clone?â€ â€œIf you were to fall asleep face-first into a soup, which soup would you want it to be?â€ â€œWhat's a better name for potato chips?â€

steps.title: Expand your network with a line that shows your sense of humor.
steps.content: Expand your network with a line that shows your sense of humor. Being able to start a conversation is an important networking skill, but it doesnâ€™t have to be stiff and formal. Novak recommends memorizing a few amusing conversation starters, so you have something ready to say once you get to a networking event. She says, â€œHaving some idea of the actual language youâ€™re going to use is really helpful.â€ Use one or more of these funny questions to help you build your professional network: â€œWhatâ€™s the strangest question youâ€™ve been asked in a job interview?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your best â€˜crazy coworkerâ€™ story?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most creative excuse youâ€™ve ever come up with to call off work?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst job youâ€™ve ever had?â€ â€œWhat weird subject could you give a 30-minute presentation on with no preparation?â€ â€œWhat random weird skill do you wish you could turn into a side hustle? â€œWhatâ€™s the strangest thing youâ€™ve ever seen on your work commute?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst job interview youâ€™ve ever had?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst Shark Tank business pitch you can think of? â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest mishap youâ€™ve had while working from home?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst advice youâ€™ve ever received?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to procrastination tactic?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest thing you do to destress?â€ â€œWhat is the best-backhanded compliment youâ€™ve heard at work?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most outdated piece of tech you still use regularly at work?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something everyone thinks is very important but you think is a waste of time?â€ â€œWhat is the funniest use of advertising youâ€™ve seen?â€ â€œWhat percentage of your day do you actually spend on social media?â€

steps.title: Keep the dinner conversation light and fun with a hilarious opener.
steps.content: Keep the dinner conversation light and fun with a hilarious opener. Dinner parties can cause anxiety whether youâ€™re with strangers, friends, or family. But with a funny question to get things going, youâ€™ll always have something to talk about. Novak suggests keeping things light by focusing on fun current events that arenâ€™t too triggering for anyone. Think of holidays, sports, music, or movies to talk aboutâ€¦or use these funny conversation starters as inspiration: â€œWhatâ€™s the grossest thing youâ€™ve ever eaten?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your most controversial hot take about a TV show?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most underrated fast food restaurant?â€ â€œWhat movie is better than the book itâ€™s based on?â€ â€œWhat movie would you like to live in?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the strangest fact you know?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best form of potato?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something you love that everyone else thinks is gross?â€ â€œWhat is the weirdest food combination that you swear by?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your biggest cooking disaster?â€ â€œWould you rather live without internet or air conditioning?â€ â€œWhoâ€™s the funniest person at the table? Why?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst fashion faux pas someone can make?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest thing a guest has ever done in your house?â€ â€œIf you were a character in Clue, which one would you be?â€ â€œWhat celebrity would play you in a movie about your life?â€ â€œWhat do you normally give your pet a pep talk about?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite funny Youtube Video?

steps.title: Give your kiddos a case of the giggles with a funny opening line.
steps.content: Give your kiddos a case of the giggles with a funny opening line. Keep things simple and fun to have the best conversation with kids. Inject a little humor right from the start and focus on their interest to get their attention and start the conversation. [2] X Research source Try one of these cute openers: â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest thing youâ€™ve ever smelled?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst thing about peanut butter and jelly sandwiches?â€ â€œWhich of the Seven Dwarves is most like you?â€ â€œWhat animal looks the silliest?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest sound you can make?â€ â€œWhich Shrek movie is the best? Why?â€ â€œDo you think Bigfoot is real?â€ â€œIf you woke up with magical powers, whatâ€™s the first thing youâ€™d do?â€ â€œWould you rather have a unicorn horn or a cat tail? Why?â€ â€œWhat would you rather fight: a hundred duck-sized horses or a horse-sized duck?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your Hogwartâ€™s House?â€ â€œIf you could only eat 1 food for an entire year, what would it be?â€ â€œWhat food does everyone love but you hate?â€ â€œIf you could hang out with any cartoon character, who would you choose and why?â€ â€œWhich are cooler: dinosaurs or dragons? Why do you think so?â€ â€œWhat is the worst superhero power you can imagine?â€ â€œWhat is worse: burping or farting at the dinner table?â€ â€œWhat would be the weirdest flavor for a potato chip?â€

steps.title: Connect with teens by using a humorous line to start the conversation.
steps.content: Connect with teens by using a humorous line to start the conversation. Humor is an excellent way to break the ice with a teenager. Ask them about their opinions and perspectives so you can learn more about who they are. [3] X Research source Use one of these funny starters to show them youâ€™re ready to have a fun, relaxed conversation: â€œWhatâ€™s an embarrassing song you secretly love?â€ â€œWhat gives you the ick?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the longest youâ€™ve gone without showering?â€ â€œDo you think you would survive the zombie apocalypse? Why or why not?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite movie monster? Why?â€ â€œIf you had an intro song that played every time you walked into a room, what would it be?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the name of your weirdest music playlist?â€ â€œWould you rather be able to read peopleâ€™s thoughts or teleport anywhere?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your least favorite word?â€ â€œWhat is the dumbest sport on the planet?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst gift youâ€™ve ever gotten?â€ â€œWhat's your weirdest autocorrect fail story?â€ â€œIf you could trade lives with a celebrity, who would it be?â€ â€œWould you rather be trapped in a romantic comedy with your enemies or a horror movie with your friends?â€ â€œWhat current hairstyle do you think people will be embarrassed about in the future?â€ â€œIf you could have a magical power you only used for pranks, what would it be?â€ â€œIf you had to wear a costume every day, what would it be?â€ â€œIf you could erase one song from the world so you never have to hear it again, what would it be?â€

steps.title: Get things started with a question that has your friends in stitches.
steps.content: Get things started with a question that has your friends in stitches. When youâ€™re chatting with a friend, you can get a little more personal with your questions. But that doesnâ€™t mean they have to be completely serious. Sharing a giggle with your bestie helps you strengthen your bond and feel closer to one another. [4] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source Use one of these amusing conversation starters the next time you chat with your best buddy: â€œHave you ever re-gifted a really bad gift? What was it?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite swear word? Why?â€ â€œWhat would be the absolute worst fragrance for a scented candle?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst joke youâ€™ve ever heard?â€ â€œWhat celebrity do you obsess over on social media?â€ â€œWhat movie scarred you when you were a kid?â€ â€œDo you have any secret superstitions?â€ â€œWhat song do you always sing in the shower?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the silliest reason you got detention in school?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most unnecessary lie youâ€™ve ever told?â€ â€œWhat old commercial jingles do you know by heart?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most embarrassing question in your Google search history?â€ â€œWhat was your last Google search?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest movie scene youâ€™ve ever seen?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest thing you do when youâ€™re home alone?â€ â€œWhat would be the worst place to take a family vacation?â€ â€œIf there were a national holiday honoring you, how would you want people to celebrate? â€œWhat silly fashion trend do you wish would come back around?â€

steps.title: Ask your partner a funny question to help you bond through laughter.
steps.content: Ask your partner a funny question to help you bond through laughter. Joking around with your significant other is a great way to build your connection and create a fun, lighthearted atmosphere in your relationship. [5] X Research source Need help coming up with something to say? Try one of these funny opening questions: â€œWhat reality show would you appear on?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the silliest nickname youâ€™ve ever had?â€ â€œIf you could break any crazy world record, what would it be?â€ â€œIf you could have dinner with any horrible person from history, who would it be?â€ â€œWhat would you name your imaginary band?â€ â€œWhat 3 things from your childhood would you take to a desert island? â€œDid you have an imaginary friend as a kid? What was it?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest place youâ€™ve met someone?â€ â€œWhat was the worst haircut you ever had?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst prank you ever played on someone?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best joke you know?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the silliest problem you have in your life right now?â€ â€œWould you rather speak in rhymes or riddles for the rest of your life?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most unusual habit you have?â€ â€œWhat are the most useless facts you know?â€ â€œWhat weird thing do you have nostalgia for?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite funny quote from a movie?â€ â€œDo you think horoscopes are accurate? Why or why not?â€

steps.title: Spice up your text conversations with a funny question.
steps.content: Spice up your text conversations with a funny question. Getting a conversation started and flirting over text can be trickier than talking to someone in person. You canâ€™t see their reactions or body language, which make up about 58% of how people communicate. [6] X Research source Fortunately, laughter is one of the easier emotions to communicate over text, thanks to emojis. Plus, if you send a funny yet flirty conversation starter, it can help you feel less anxiety about the interaction. Type in one of these for a low-stress way to things started: â€œWhat 3 emojis would you use to describe yourself?â€ â€œWhat are your thoughts on stinky cheese?â€ğŸ§€ğŸ‘ƒğŸ˜¤ â€œIf you could keep a mythical creature as your pet, what would it be?â€ğŸ¦„ğŸ§šâ€â™‚ï¸ â€œWhat food best describes your personality?ğŸ¥«ğŸğŸ”ğŸ¥¡ğŸ‘ğŸ† â€œWhat do you think is the funniest porn name?â€ğŸ˜ â€œCan you describe your ideal partner using 3 emojis?â€ ğŸ§ ğŸ˜„ğŸ’– â€œDo you think your pet judges you?â€ğŸ¤” â€œWhat is the sexiest name youâ€™ve ever heard?â€ ğŸ«¦ğŸ˜‰ â€œIf you discovered a new planetğŸª, whatâ€™s the weirdest name you would give it?ğŸ¤­ â€œIf you were a dessert, which one would you be?â€ğŸ°ğŸ¥§ğŸ©ğŸ¡ â€œWhat is your snobbiest coffee order?â€â˜• â€œFruits, vegetables, or Belgian chocolate and tears?â€ ğŸ«ğŸ˜­ â€œWhatâ€™s the most unusual thing you find attractive in a person?â€ğŸ¤­ â€œWould you choose immortality or unbridled sexual attraction?â€ğŸ˜ˆğŸ”¥ â€œUsing only emojis, how would you describe twerking to my grandpa?â€ ğŸ’“ğŸ’“ğŸ’“ â€œWhat emoji looks the most like you?â€ğŸ‘€ğŸ˜œ

steps.title: Enter the chat with a hilarious opening line.
steps.content: Enter the chat with a hilarious opening line. When you match with someone on Tinder, it can be hard to know what to say to get a good conversation going. The good news is that chatting on Tinder is easy and low-risk because you donâ€™t have to be emotionally vulnerable. [7] X Research source So take a deep breath and pick one of these funny conversation starters to charm them from the very first word: â€œTacos or burritos?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest music genre on your Spotify Wrapped?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the nerdiest thing you did last week? â€œWhatâ€™s the most underrated holiday?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst pick-up line someoneâ€™s used on you?â€ â€œAre you more afraid of spiders or saying, â€˜You too!â€™ when a server says, â€˜Enjoy your mealâ€™?â€ â€œSoâ€¦do you come here often?â€ â€œIf your mom were a shoe, what kind of shoe would she be?â€ â€œDo you also still think about all the embarrassing things you said in middle school, or are you a well-adjusted adult?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best type of cheese?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your definition of the strangest day ever?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to late-night Grub-Hub order?â€ â€œWould you rather always be a little bit damp or a little bit sticky?â€ â€œUsing only emojis, can you explain to me how to set the clock on my oven?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the first thing youâ€™d do in a zombie apocalypse?â€ â€œWho is your weirdest celebrity crush?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your least favorite pasta shape?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something about you that would impress my grandma?â€

steps.title: Make a great impression with a funny conversation starter.
steps.content: Make a great impression with a funny conversation starter. Dating coach and matchmaker Judith Gottesman says that laughter is a good way to connect with another person. Plus, it helps you both relax, which makes having a great conversation â€”and date!â€”that much easier. Try one of these questions to dazzle that special someone with your sense of humor: â€œOn a scale of 1-10, how competitive are you at Monopoly?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your guilty pleasure snack?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your weirdest dealbreaker?â€ â€œDo you have a signature dance move?â€ â€œDo you sleep in socks? Why or why not?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest pet name youâ€™ve ever been called by a significant other?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst date youâ€™ve ever been on?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite celebrity scandal?â€ â€œIf you could be indestructible for one day, what would you do?â€ â€œWhat is the most ridiculous thing youâ€™ve ever done when bored?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most embarrassing thing youâ€™ve ever seen?â€ â€œIf you were a superhero, who would be your sidekick?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst thing about a first date?â€ â€œCan you share the weirdest experience you have had while traveling?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite cheesy pick-up line?â€ â€œWhat is the silliest lie you have ever told and gotten caught for it?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most revolting ice cream flavor youâ€™ve ever tried?â€ â€œIf you were a cartoon character, which other cartoon character would you like to marry?â€

steps.title: Use active listening so you can give good responses.
steps.content: Use active listening so you can give good responses. The main reason to be an active listener is to show the other person youâ€™re paying attention and interested in what they have to say. Jean says the best way to do this is to smile, make eye contact, and listen more than you talk during the conversation. Another way to let someone know youâ€™re listening is to nod occasionally or say something like, â€œThatâ€™s interesting.â€ The idea behind active listening is to show youâ€™re really thinking about what the other person is talking about instead of just waiting for your turn to talk. Even when they pause for you to talk, take a few seconds to consider or summarize what they just said.

steps.title: Ask follow-up questions to encourage them to say more.
steps.content: Ask follow-up questions to encourage them to say more. Make sure your follow-up questions are open-ended and can't be answered with 1-2 words, though. For example, questions like, â€œWhat makes you feel that way?â€ or â€œHow did that go?â€ are great follow-up questions because they allow the other person to share their thoughts. Gottesman says when you let the other person talk about themselves, theyâ€™re more likely to think youâ€™re extremely interesting and entertaining. Other open-ended follow-up questions you can ask to keep your conversation going are: â€œCan you tell me more about that?â€ â€œHow did you feel about that?â€ â€œWhat did you do next?â€ â€œHow did that turn out?â€ â€œWhy did you decide on that?â€

steps.title: End the conversation or introduce a new topic during a lull.
steps.content: End the conversation or introduce a new topic during a lull. The best time to change the topic or end the conversation is when you sense an awkward silence coming. By heading off an awkward pause, you avoid rambling or just uncomfortably standing there staring at each other. Easy questions like asking if theyâ€™ve seen a popular movie or TV show are a great way to get out of awkward silences or steer the conversation in a new direction to keep it going. [8] X Research source If youâ€™ve run out of things to talk about, end the conversation gracefully to leave the other person with a good impression. Excuse yourself to get a drink or say something like, â€œI have to go, but it was nice talking with you.â€ Another way to end a conversation without being rude is to make a plan to meet in the future. For example, â€œHey, I have to head out. Letâ€™s have lunch next week. Iâ€™ll text you to set something up.â€ [9] X Research source
